{{Infobox political party |country=Ukraine |party_name = People's Self-Defense Political Party |name_native = ÐÐ¾Ð»ÑÑÐ¸ÑÐ½Ð° Ð¿Ð°ÑÑÑÑ ÐÐ°ÑÐ¾Ð´Ð½Ð° Ð¡Ð°Ð¼Ð¾Ð¾Ð±Ð¾ÑÐ¾Ð½Ð° |party_logo = |leader = [[Yuriy Lutsenko]]<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/98630/print/ Prosecutor's office refuses to release Lutsenko on bail, says People's Self-Defense], [[Kyiv Post]] (March 1, 2011)</ref> |foundation = {{start date|1999|2|6}}<ref>[http://www.commersant.ua/doc.html?DocID=893514 Ð®ÑÐ¸Ð¹ ÐÑÑÐµÐ½ÐºÐ¾ Ð¼ÐµÐ½ÑÐµÑ Ð²ÑÐ²ÐµÑÐºÑ], [[Kommersant]] (30 January 2009) (in Russian)</ref> |ideology = |position = |international = None |colours = Red |colorcode=Red |headquarters= 10a [[Lesya Ukrainka]] Boulevard in [[Kiev]]<ref name=namegame/> |website = http://www.nso.org.ua }}
'''People's Self-Defense Political Party''' ({{lang-uk|ÐÐ¾Ð»ÑÑÐ¸ÑÐ½Ð° Ð¿Ð°ÑÑÑÑ ÐÐ°ÑÐ¾Ð´Ð½Ð° Ð¡Ð°Ð¼Ð¾Ð¾Ð±Ð¾ÑÐ¾Ð½Ð°}}) is a [[political party]] in [[Ukraine]]. The party was formally named (till April 2010<ref name=namegame/>) '''Forward, Ukraine!'''<ref>Party's name was sometimes translated as ''Go Ahead Ukraine!''</ref> ({{lang-uk|ÐÐ¿ÐµÑÐµÐ´, Ð£ÐºÑÐ°ÑÐ½Ð¾!}}; ''Vpered, Ukrajino!'').
==History== ===Forward, Ukraine!=== The Forward, Ukraine! Party was registered by the Justice Ministry on May 13, 1999.<ref name=namegame/><ref name=DATA>{{uk icon}} [http://www.da-ta.com.ua/mon_mainnews/855.htm ÐÐ¾Ð»ÑÑÐ¸ÑÐ½Ð° Ð¿Ð°ÑÑÑÑ âÐÐ°ÑÐ¾Ð´Ð½Ð° Ð¡Ð°Ð¼Ð¾Ð¾Ð±Ð¾ÑÐ¾Ð½Ð°â], Database DATA</ref>
At the [[Ukrainian parliamentary election, 2002|2002 elections]], the party was part of the [[Viktor Yushchenko Bloc Our Ukraine]].<ref name=DATA/>
At the [[Ukrainian parliamentary election, 2006|2006 elections]] it decided to participate alone gathering only 6,934 votes (0.02%).<ref name=DATA/>
At the [[Ukrainian parliamentary election, 2007|2007 elections]], the party joined Viktor's Yushchenko Bloc once more within the [[Yuriy Lutsenko's People's Self-Defense]]. The party was part of the [[Our UkraineâPeople's Self-Defense Bloc|Our Ukraine]] alliance,<ref name=DATA/> that won 72 out of 450 seats. [[File:Forward Ukraine logo.jpg|thumb|Forward Ukraine party logo]] In an interview with the Silski Visti (Village News) newspaper on 29 January 2009 [[Ministry of Internal Affairs (Ukraine)|interior minister]] [[Yuriy Lutsenko]] declared that [[Civil Movement "People's Self-Defense"]] as an insurgent, protesting, and not very structured civil movement has ceased to exist". Lutsenko also said he was planning to direct the organisational changes of Forward, Ukraine!.<ref>[http://www.interfax.com.ua/eng/main/6595/ Interior minister planning to set up full-fledged political force], [[Interfax|Interfax-Ukraine]] (29-01-2009)</ref>
The party supported [[Yulia Tymoshenko]] as presidential candidate in the [[Ukrainian presidential election, 2010]].<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/54883/ Interior Minister takes short leave, urges voters to support Tymoshenko], [[Kyiv Post]] (December 11, 2009)</ref> The party did not support the dismissal of the [[second Tymoshenko Government]].<ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/60876/ Kyrylenko: For Ukraine! group of deputies not to vote for government's dismissal], [[Kyiv Post]] (March 3, 2010)</ref><ref>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/60449/ For Ukraine! group of deputies not in coalition talks], [[Kyiv Post]] (February 25)</ref>
===People's Self-Defense Political Party=== At the ninth congress of the Forward, Ukraine! Party on February 26, 2010 the decision was taken to rename the party.<ref name=namegame/> Justice Minister [[Oleksandr Lavrynovych]] signed a relevant decree April 20, 2010.<ref name=namegame>[http://www.kyivpost.com/news/politics/detail/64605/ Forward, Ukraine! Party changes name to People's Self-Defense], [[Kyiv Post]] (April 21, 2010)</ref>
On August 4, 2010 Yuriy Lutsenko declared that the party would participate in the [[Ukraine local elections, 2010|2010 local elections]] in collaboration with [[All-Ukrainian Union "Fatherland"]] on joined lists.<ref>{{uk icon}} [http://www.nso.org.ua/ua/news/7410 Â«ÐÐ¡Â» Ð½Ð° Ð¼ÑÑÑÐµÐ²Ð¸Ñ Ð²Ð¸Ð±Ð¾ÑÐ°Ñ Ð¾Ð±âÑÐ´Ð½Ð°ÑÑÑÑÑ ÑÐ· Â«ÐÐ°ÑÑÐºÑÐ²ÑÐ¸Ð½Ð¾ÑÂ»], Party's official website (August 4, 2010)</ref> But eventually the party did independently participate in the election.<ref name=trusk>[http://truskavets-city.gov.ua/modules.php?name=Vlada&op=list_content&eid=10 ÐÑÐ´ÑÐ¾Ð·Ð´ÑÐ»Ð¸ ÐÐ ], Official website of [[Truskavets]]</ref><ref name=elec2010/> Now with much success, the party won no representatives in [[Ukrainian Oblasts|Oblast]] Councils (regional parliaments); its biggest success was winning seats in the city council of several towns in the [[Lviv Oblast]].<ref name=trusk/><ref name=elec2010>{{uk icon}} [http://www.nso.org.ua/ua/region/7736 ÐÑÐ²ÑÐ²ÑÑÐºÐ° Â«ÐÐ¡Â»: Ð¿ÐµÑÑÑ Ð¿ÐµÑÐµÐ¼Ð¾Ð³Ð¸], Party's official website (November 2, 2010)</ref><ref>{{uk icon}} [http://www.pravda.com.ua/articles/2010/11/8/5552584/ Results of the elections, preliminary data, on interactive maps] by [[Ukrayinska Pravda]] (November 8, 2010)</ref>
